name: Cleenseau - Session 27
tagline: negotiation, infiltration, and rising paranoia in Veltor
shortSummary: In Veltor, the party navigates oath-bound suspicion, rumor-gathering, and legal maneuvering around the Baroness’s possible fey pact as paranoia about necromancy escalates.
longSummary: Arriving near Veltor by feather fall, Robin, Viepuck, Celyn, and Izgil enter a town where all magic is forbidden and must negotiate oaths under Marian’s strained truth-compelling miracle. They spend the day gathering rumors at the Granite Mug, checking in with the Merriweathers and other contacts, and probing the politics around Baroness Isabeau d'Aslain’s suspected pact with the slain fairy Areschera. After Viepuck’s urchin-disguise infiltration and disappearance triggers alarm, Etienne is jailed, consultations with Victorine Rosseau, Thomas Dyerson, and steward Emeric only heighten the sense of a rigged game, and Sylvan evidence about the Baroness’s dealings is produced but left unread. A pendant ruse using Rene d’Aslain’s sketch and Izgil’s locate-object misdirection further tangles matters, scrying on Robin is detected, and the party is shuffled to the former fairy tower barracks before a courtyard accusation of murder and necromancy culminates in Robin’s public challenge and an overnight public holding as the Heroes of the Night Queen advance their separate assault.

npcs.name: Isabeau d'Aslain
npcs.notes: Baroness of Aveil, suspected of making a pact with the fairy Areschera and driving the sham necromancy case.

npcs.name: Marian
npcs.notes: Disciple of the Warlord whose costly miracle of truth shapes the oath negotiations.

npcs.name: Etienne des Ostieux
npcs.notes: Captain of the Guard, later jailed amid the rising paranoia.

npcs.name: The Merriweathers
npcs.notes: Halfling tailors tied to the halfling intelligence network, consulted for rumors and later vanished.

npcs.name: Emeric
npcs.notes: Castle steward involved in consultations about the situation in Veltor.

npcs.name: Victorine Rosseau
npcs.notes: Head magistrate of Veltor, deeply uncomfortable with the Baroness's machinations.

npcs.name: Thomas Dyerson
npcs.notes: Circuit magistrate allied with the party, who delivers the irregular indictment.

npcs.name: Esme d'Aslain
npcs.notes: The Baroness's niece, fearful yet fascinated by magic.

npcs.name: Rene d'Aslain
npcs.notes: Artistic nephew whose pendant sketch is used in a locate-object ruse.

npcs.name: Graymalkin
npcs.notes: Robin's gryphon companion and visible symbol of the party's reputation.

npcs.name: Robert I (the lich)
npcs.notes: The king Viepuck names a lich, truly Malach's identity, referenced via self-detection magic.

npcs.name: Areschera
npcs.notes: Murderous fairy previously slain by the party; her former tower and pact with the Baroness loom over events.

npcs.name: Alric Veillon
npcs.notes: Runner from the Warlord temple who fetches Marian for the oath negotiations.

places.name: Veltor
places.notes: Capital of the Barony of Aveil and site of the unfolding paranoia.

places.name: Granite Mug

places.notes: Inn for law clerks in Veltor.
